docs.abstract: The rates vary tremendously from state to state.
docs.snippet: The rates vary tremendously from state to state.

headline.main: The 'Pregnancy Police' Are Everywhere (Even in Your Head)

docs.abstract: Are pregnant women who color their hair - or paint their toenails, or hire a baby nurse, or choose a stroller over a sling, or go back to work early - rebelling against their peers, or against their own ever-evolving ideals?
docs.snippet: Are pregnant women who color their hair - or paint their toenails, or hire a baby nurse, or choose a stroller over a sling, or go back to work early - rebelling against their peers, or against their own ever-evolving ideals?

docs.lead_paragraph: The Romney campaign removed ads critical of Rick Santorum after Mr. Santorum’s disabled daughter, Bella, was hospitalized.

headline.main: A Shift in Strategy in Pennsylvania for Romney
headline.print_headline: A Shift in Strategy in Pennsylvania for Romney

docs.abstract: Romney campaign pulls ads critical of Republican presidential rival Rick Santorum in Pennsylvania after Santorum’s three-year-old disabled daughter, Bella, is hospitalized; her medical struggles--and the public outpouring of sympathy for her--have the potential to complicate Romney's efforts to quickly end the Republican nominating fight.
docs.snippet: The Romney campaign removed ads critical of Rick Santorum after Mr. Santorum’s disabled daughter, Bella, was hospitalized.

byline.contributor: Trip Gabriel reported from New York, and Katharine Q. Seelye from Bedford, Pa.
byline.original: By TRIP GABRIEL and KATHARINE Q. SEELYE

docs.lead_paragraph: Taking antidepressants during pregnancy raises the risk of high blood pressure in expectant mothers, a new study shows. Antidepressants are one of the most commonly used medications in pregnancy, and hypertension can cause problems for both mother and child. About one in five women suffer from depression during pregnancy, and up to 14 percent of those women end up using an antidepressant medication to treat it.

headline.main: Vital Signs: Risks: Checking Antidepressant Use in Pregnancy

docs.abstract: Anick Berard study in The British Journal of Clinical Pharmacology finds that taking antidepressants during pregnancy raises the risk of high blood pressure in expectant mothers. (M)
docs.snippet: Taking antidepressants during pregnancy raises the risk of high blood pressure in expectant mothers, a new study shows.      Antidepressants are one of the most commonly used medications in pregnancy, and hypertension can cause problems for both...

docs.lead_paragraph: Tammy Kwarciak, a 44-year-old nurse whose weight had been creeping up for years, was determined to lose 50 pounds. So in February, she drove from her home in Port Huron, Mich., across the border into Canada and had a small balloonlike device inserted into her stomach. The intragastric balloon, filled with liquid and left in the stomach for up to six months, is not approved for use in the United States, though it's available in Europe, South America and other parts of the world. Clinical trials required to win federal Food and Drug Administration approval are being initiated, but many Americans aren't waiting.

headline.main: Impatience To Get Thin Sends Some To Canada

docs.abstract: Growing number of Americans are traveling to Canada in order to undergo intragastric balloon surgery for weight loss; balloons filled with liquid are left in the stomach for up to six months, allowing patients to feel satiety on less food; procedure is currently undergoing clinical trials to win approval by the Food and Drug Administration, which has in the past been concerned about the severe and frequent complications associated with the device. (M)

headline.print_headline: Impatience To Get Thin Sends Some To Canada

docs.abstract: Americans are heading north of the border for a weight-loss procedure not available here: the gastric balloon.

docs.lead_paragraph: Gender-reveal baby parties are a modern way to savor the surprise and share it with others, or perhaps just to enjoy it somewhere other than a doctor’s office.

headline.seo: At Parties, Revealing a Baby’s Gender
headline.main: A Boy or Girl? Cut the Cake
headline.print_headline: A Boy or Girl? Cut the Cake

docs.abstract: Gender-reveal parties, during which expectant parents share the moment they discover their baby's sex, are increasingly popular; according to American Pregnancy Assn, at least 50 percent of parents choose to find out the sex of their baby beforehand, and a gender-reveal party is a modern way to savor the surprise.
docs.snippet: Gender-reveal baby parties are a modern way to savor the surprise and share it with others, or perhaps just to enjoy it somewhere other than a doctor’s office.

byline.original: By ALEX WILLIAMS and KATE MURPHY
